news_header: Archaeologists discovered two medieval cities in eastern Uzbekistan, challenging previous beliefs about Silk Road trade routes.
news_text: Archaeologists have uncovered the remains of two medieval cities, Tugunbulak and Tashbulak, in the mountains of eastern Uzbekistan, which may change our understanding of the Silk Road. These cities, located at high altitudes, were believed to be bustling settlements between the 8th and 11th centuries. The discovery was made using remote sensing technology, including drones and lidar, revealing significant architectural features and evidence of iron production. The findings highlight the historical significance of high-altitude urbanism and the interconnections of ancient communities in Central Asia.
